thread.title: Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame Seeks Its Next Slate of Deserving Inductees
thread.title_full: Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame Seeks Its Next Slate of Deserving Inductees

author: Sport Manitoba
title: Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame Seeks Its Next Slate of Deserving Inductees
text:
Nominations now open for the Class of 2025.
March 19, 2025 – Winnipeg MB – Nominations are now open for the Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame’s Class of 2025. All members of the public are invited to nominate a deserving candidate by 11:30 p.m. on Tuesday, April 15. The nominees, along with those who have been on the ballot without successful selection for three years, will be eligible for consideration.
Nominations can be made in one of four categories:
- Individual Athlete
- Builder
- Athlete/Builder
- Team
“The annual Hall of Fame induction provides an important way for us to acknowledge and celebrate Manitoba’s athletes, builders, and teams,” said Janet McMahon, Sport Manitoba President & CEO. “There are so many individuals who deserve recognition, and I hope Manitobans take the opportunity to submit nominations. I look forward to hearing about our 2025 nominees!”
To be eligible for consideration, a candidate must be born or lived in Manitoba, or spent the highlighted portion of their career competing for our province.
“The nomination season for the Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame is exceedingly meaningful,” said Matthew Leibl, Chair of the Selection Committee. “Seeing the inspiring stories we collect in this stage is remarkable.”
Nominate a deserving individual or team using our Nomination Form and provide supporting documents to halloffame@sportmanitoba.ca.
The Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame’s Selection Committee will meet in May to determine its slate of nominees, which will ultimately be approved by its Board of Directors. Formal introduction of the Class of 2025 will follow.
About
A program of Sport Manitoba, the Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame’s mandate is to collect, preserve, showcase and celebrate the history and heritage of sport excellence in Manitoba. For more information, please visit the website.
Sport Manitoba is a not-for-profit organization and the lead planning, programming and funding agency for the development of amateur sport in Manitoba. Located at 145 Pacific Avenue in Winnipeg, Sport Manitoba partners with over 100 organizations to deliver sport in the province and is responsible for programs including the Manitoba Games powered by Manitoba Hydro, Sport Manitoba Coaching, Team Manitoba, Manitoba Sports Hall of Fame, Fit Kids Healthy Kids, and KidSport. Services provided include the Sport Manitoba Clinic, Sport Manitoba Performance, Sport Manitoba Fitness Centre, and the Paul Robson Resource Centre for Leadership and Coaching. Safe Sport Line: 1-833-656-SAFE (7233)
